info.title: Smart Rollup Node RPCs

get.description: Returns the rollup node configuration

smart-rollup-node-operator.description: Operators that sign operations of the smart rollup, by purpose

reconnection_delay.description: The reconnection (to the tezos node) delay in seconds

fee-parameters.description: The fee parameters for each purpose used when injecting operations in L1

minimal-nanotez-per-byte.description: Exclude operations with lower fees per byte

minimal-nanotez-per-gas-unit.description: Exclude operations with lower gas fees

force-low-fee.description: Don't check that the fee is lower than the estimated default

mode.description: The mode for this rollup node

loser-mode.description: If enabled, the rollup node will issue wrong commitments (for test only!)

unsafe-pvm-patches.description: Unsafe patches to apply to the PVM. For tests only, don't set this value in production.

execute-outbox-messages-filter.description: A filter to select which outbox messages the rollup will execute automatically (must be in maintenance or operator mode).

oneOf.title: any_destination
oneOf.description: Accept any destination.

oneOf.title: destination_among
oneOf.description: Accept destination that matches the given list (in base58-check).

oneOf.title: any_entrypoint
oneOf.description: Accept any entrypoint.

oneOf.title: entrypoint_among
oneOf.description: Accept entrypoint of the given list.

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: RPCs documentation and input/output schema

schema.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Layer-2 block of the layer-2 chain with respect to a Layer 1 block identifier

level.description: Level of the block, corresponds to the level of the tezos block.

predecessor.description: Predecessor hash of the Tezos block.

commitment_hash.description: Hash of this block's commitment if any was computed for it.

previous_commitment_hash.description: Previous commitment hash in the chain. If there is a commitment for this block, this field contains the commitment that was previously computed.

context.description: Hash of the layer 2 context for this block.

inbox_witness.description: Witness for the inbox for this block, i.e. the Merkle hash of payloads of messages.

inbox_hash.description: Hash of the inbox for this block.

messages.description: Messages added to the inbox in this block.

commitment.description: Commitment, if any is computed for this block.

outbox.description: Outbox messages produced by PVM execution of inbox

initial_tick.description: Initial tick of the PVM at this block, i.e. before evaluation of the messages.

num_ticks.description: Number of ticks produced by the evaluation of the messages in this block.

log_kernel_debug_file.description: File in which to emit kernel logs. This file will be created in <data-dir>/simulation_kernel_logs/, where <data-dir> is the data directory of the rollup node.

state_hash.description: Hash of the state after execution of the PVM on the input messages

status.description: Status of the PVM after evaluation

output.description: Output produced by evaluation of the messages

inbox_level.description: Level of the inbox that would contain these messages

num_ticks.description: Ticks taken by the PVM for evaluating the messages

insights.description: PVM state values requested after the simulation

get.description: List messages present in the batcher's queue

get.description: Retrieve an L2 message and its status

oneOf.title: unknown
oneOf.description: The message is not known by the batcher.

oneOf.title: pending_batch
oneOf.description: The message is in the batcher queue.

oneOf.title: pending_injection
oneOf.description: The message is batched but not injected yet.

oneOf.title: injected
oneOf.description: The message is injected as part of an L1 operation but it is not included in a block.

oneOf.title: included
oneOf.description: The message is included in an inbox in an L1 block.

oneOf.title: committed
oneOf.description: The message is included in a committed inbox on L1.

get.description: Information about garbage collection

first_available_level.description: First level where data is guaranteed to be available in the rollup node.

last_gc_level.description: The level at which the last GC was triggered.

last_context_split_level.description: The level at which the context was split for the last time. Commits before this level are in other chunks.

last_successful_gc_target.description: The level which was the target of the last successful GC.

021-PsquebeC.contract_id.originated.title: A contract handle -- originated account
021-PsquebeC.contract_id.originated.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 originated contract hash.

bignum.description: Decimal representation of a big number

error.description: An error trace. The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

injector_operation_hash.title: An identifier (hash) for an operation in the injector (Base58Check-encoded)

mutez.title: A millionth of a tez
mutez.description: One million mutez make a tez (1 tez = 1e6 mutez)

nanotez.title: A thousandth of a mutez
nanotez.description: One thousand nanotez make a mutez (1 tez = 1e9 nanotez)

positive_bignum.title: Positive big number
positive_bignum.description: Decimal representation of a positive big number

sc_l2_message.description: A hex encoded smart rollup message

sc_rollup_l2_message_id.title: A smart rollup layer 2 message identifier (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_commitment_hash.title: The hash of a commitment of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

smart_rollup_inbox_hash.title: The hash of an inbox of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

timestamp.protocol.description: A timestamp as seen by the protocol: second-level precision, epoch based.

unistring.title: Universal string representation
unistring.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.
